q: The quieter you become, the more you are able to hear.
h:
“The quieter you become, the more you are able to hear.” —
Rumi

q: Definitions belong to the definers, not the defined.
h:
“Definitions belong to the definers, not the defined.” —
Toni Morrison

q: The longer we dwell on our misfortunes, the greater is their power to harm us.
h:
“The longer we dwell on our misfortunes, the greater is their power to harm us.” —
Voltaire

q: Happiness depends upon ourselves.
h:
“Happiness depends upon ourselves.” —
Aristotle

q: Setting goals is the first step in turning the invisible into the visible.
h:
“Setting goals is the first step in turning the invisible into the visible.” —
Tony Robbins

q: Rest when you're weary. Refresh and renew yourself, your body, your mind, your spirit. Then get back to work.
h:
“Rest when you're weary. Refresh and renew yourself, your body, your mind, your spirit. Then get back to work.” —
Ralph Marston

q: It is easier to fight for one's principles than to live up to them.
h:
“It is easier to fight for one's principles than to live up to them. ” —
Alfred Adler

q: One beam, no matter how big, cannot support an entire house on its own.
h:
“One beam, no matter how big, cannot support an entire house on its own.” —
Chinese Proverb

q: Peace is not something you wish for; It's something you make, something you do, something you are, and something you give away.
h:
“Peace is not something you wish for; It's something you make, something you do, something you are, and something you give away.” —
John Lennon

q: Why do you stay in prison when the door is so wide open?
h:
“Why do you stay in prison when the door is so wide open?” —
Rumi

q: The energy of the mind is the essence of life.
h:
“The energy of the mind is the essence of life.” —
Aristotle

q: It is ignorance that causes most mistakes.
h:
“It is ignorance that causes most mistakes.” —
Harry S. Truman

q: Everything is possible. The impossible just takes longer.
h:
“Everything is possible. The impossible just takes longer.” —
Dan Brown

q: When you're at the end of your rope, tie a knot and hold on.
h:
“When you're at the end of your rope, tie a knot and hold on.” —
Theodore Roosevelt

q: I don't walk away from things that I think are unfinished.
h:
“I don't walk away from things that I think are unfinished.” —
Arnold Schwarzenegger

q: Far more crucial than what we know or do not know is what we do not want to know.
h:
“Far more crucial than what we know or do not know is what we do not want to know.” —
Eric Hoffer

q: We can change our lives. We can do, have, and be exactly what we wish.
h:
“We can change our lives. We can do, have, and be exactly what we wish.” —
Tony Robbins

q: The past has no power over the present moment.
h:
“The past has no power over the present moment. ” —
Eckhart Tolle

q: The best way out is always through.
h:
“The best way out is always through.” —
Robert Frost

q: You get in life what you have the courage to ask for.
h:
“You get in life what you have the courage to ask for.” —
Oprah Winfrey

q: Whenever you do a thing, act as if all the world were watching.
h:
“Whenever you do a thing, act as if all the world were watching.” —
Thomas Jefferson

q: Many roads lead to the path, but basically there are only two: reason and practice.
h:
“Many roads lead to the path, but basically there are only two: reason and practice. ” —
Bodhidharma

q: Heal the past, live the present, dream the future.
h:
“Heal the past, live the present, dream the future.” —
Mary Engelbreit

q: Nothing will work unless you do.
h:
“Nothing will work unless you do.” —
Maya Angelou

q: No tree, it is said, can grow to heaven unless its roots reach down to hell.
h:
“No tree, it is said, can grow to heaven unless its roots reach down to hell.” —
Carl Jung

q: Have the fearless attitude of a hero and the loving heart of a child.
h:
“Have the fearless attitude of a hero and the loving heart of a child.” —
Soyen Shaku

q: If I can pay the bills, I'm happy.
h:
“If I can pay the bills, I'm happy.” —
Morgan Wootten

q: Intelligent men are cruel. Stupid men are monstrously cruel.
h:
“Intelligent men are cruel. Stupid men are monstrously cruel.” —
Jack London

q: Learn the rules like a pro, so you can break them like an artist.
h:
“Learn the rules like a pro, so you can break them like an artist.” —
Pablo Picasso

q: If you practiced for the day, then you have won. If you were lazy for the day, then you have lost.
h:
“If you practiced for the day, then you have won. If you were lazy for the day, then you have lost.” —
Ming-Dao Deng

q: Superstars think like superstars long before the fans or the press anoint them.
h:
“Superstars think like superstars long before the fans or the press anoint them.” —
John Eliot

q: Nothing brings down walls as surely as acceptance.
h:
“Nothing brings down walls as surely as acceptance.” —
Deepak Chopra

q: We must learn to live together as brothers or perish together as fools.
h:
“We must learn to live together as brothers or perish together as fools.” —
Martin Luther King, Jr.

q: A crisis is an opportunity riding the dangerous wind.
h:
“A crisis is an opportunity riding the dangerous wind.” —
Chinese Proverb

q: The dream is free, but the hustle is sold separately.
h:
“The dream is free, but the hustle is sold separately.” —
Steve Harvey

q: Engage in those actions and thoughts that nurture the good qualities you want to have.
h:
“Engage in those actions and thoughts that nurture the good qualities you want to have.” —
Paramahansa Yogananda

q: You can discover what your enemy fears most by observing the means he uses to frighten you.
h:
“You can discover what your enemy fears most by observing the means he uses to frighten you.” —
Eric Hoffer

q: Surrender to what is. Let go of what was. Have faith in what will be.
h:
“Surrender to what is. Let go of what was. Have faith in what will be.” —
Sonia Ricotti

q: I skate to where the puck is going to be, not where it has been.
h:
“I skate to where the puck is going to be, not where it has been.” —
Wayne Gretzky

q: It's not the love you make. It's the love you give.
h:
“It's not the love you make. It's the love you give. ” —
Nikola Tesla

q: Never spend your money before you have earned it.
h:
“Never spend your money before you have earned it.” —
Thomas Jefferson

q: I will love the light for it shows me the way, yet I will endure the darkness because it shows me the stars.
h:
“I will love the light for it shows me the way, yet I will endure the darkness because it shows me the stars.” —
Og Mandino

q: It's not how much money you make, it's how much money you keep.
h:
“It's not how much money you make, it's how much money you keep.” —
Robert Kiyosaki

q: Everything you look at can become a fairy tale and you can get a story from everything you touch.
h:
“Everything you look at can become a fairy tale and you can get a story from everything you touch.” —
Hans Christian Andersen

q: Only to the extent that we expose ourselves over and over to annihilation can that which is indestructible in us be found.
h:
“Only to the extent that we expose ourselves over and over to annihilation can that which is indestructible in us be found.” —
Pema Chodron

q: Do not look for approval except for the consciousness of doing your best.
h:
“Do not look for approval except for the consciousness of doing your best.” —
Andrew Carnegie

q: There is no medicine like hope, no incentive so great, and no tonic so powerful as expectation of something tomorrow.
h:
“There is no medicine like hope, no incentive so great, and no tonic so powerful as expectation of something tomorrow. ” —
Orison Swett Marden

q: You already have every characteristic necessary for success if you recognize, claim, develop and use them.
h:
“You already have every characteristic necessary for success if you recognize, claim, develop and use them.” —
Zig Ziglar

q: Today is the oldest you've ever been, and the youngest you'll ever be again.
h:
“Today is the oldest you've ever been, and the youngest you'll ever be again.” —
Eleanor Roosevelt

q: Freedom is the only worthy goal in life. It is won by disregarding things that lie beyond our control.
h:
“Freedom is the only worthy goal in life. It is won by disregarding things that lie beyond our control.” —
Epictetus

q: By failing to prepare, you are preparing to fail.
h:
“By failing to prepare, you are preparing to fail.” —
Benjamin Franklin

q: Whatever your mind can conceive and believe, it can achieve.
h:
“Whatever your mind can conceive and believe, it can achieve.” —
Napoleon Hill

q: It is not fair to ask of others what you are not willing to do yourself.
h:
“It is not fair to ask of others what you are not willing to do yourself.” —
Eleanor Roosevelt

q: Life is like stepping onto a boat which is about to sail out to sea and sink.
h:
“Life is like stepping onto a boat which is about to sail out to sea and sink.” —
Shunryu Suzuki

q: One of the most difficult things is not to change society - but to change yourself.
h:
“One of the most difficult things is not to change society - but to change yourself.” —
Nelson Mandela

q: When one door closes another door opens.
h:
“When one door closes another door opens. ” —
Alexander Graham Bell

q: In the midst of chaos, there is also opportunity.
h:
“In the midst of chaos, there is also opportunity.” —
Sun Tzu

q: Is it really possible to tell someone else what one feels?
h:
“Is it really possible to tell someone else what one feels?” —
Leo Tolstoy

q: Making your mark on the world is hard. If it were easy, everybody would do it.
h:
“Making your mark on the world is hard. If it were easy, everybody would do it.” —
Barack Obama

q: If you love somebody, let them go, for if they return, they were always yours. If they don't, they never were.
h:
“If you love somebody, let them go, for if they return, they were always yours. If they don't, they never were.” —
Kahlil Gibran

q: First learn the meaning of what you say, and then speak.
h:
“First learn the meaning of what you say, and then speak.” —
Epictetus

q: Enlightenment is intimacy with all things.
h:
“Enlightenment is intimacy with all things.” —
Dogen

q: Make yourself so useful to other people, that they think you are irreplaceable.
h:
“Make yourself so useful to other people, that they think you are irreplaceable.” —
Og Mandino

q: A man's worth is no greater than his ambitions.
h:
“A man's worth is no greater than his ambitions.” —
Marcus Aurelius

q: The biggest and only critic lives in your perception of people's perception of you rather than people's perception of you.
h:
“The biggest and only critic lives in your perception of people's perception of you rather than people's perception of you.” —
Criss Jami

q: We turn not older with years but newer every day.
h:
“We turn not older with years but newer every day.” —
Emily Dickinson

q: No kind action ever stops with itself. One kind action leads to another. Good example is followed.
h:
“No kind action ever stops with itself. One kind action leads to another. Good example is followed.” —
Amelia Earhart

q: If you want to be successful, you have to jump, there's no way around it.
h:
“If you want to be successful, you have to jump, there's no way around it.” —
Steve Harvey

q: People are not disturbed by things, but by the views they take of them.
h:
“People are not disturbed by things, but by the views they take of them.” —
Epictetus

q: Do all things with love.
h:
“Do all things with love.” —
Og Mandino

q: You have to keep breaking your heart until it opens.
h:
“You have to keep breaking your heart until it opens.” —
Rumi

q: The less you want, the richer you are. The more you need in order to be happy, the more miserable you'll be.
h:
“The less you want, the richer you are. The more you need in order to be happy, the more miserable you'll be.” —
Yanni

q: Who you are is defined by what you're willing to struggle for.
h:
“Who you are is defined by what you're willing to struggle for.” —
Mark Manson

q: Knowing is not enough, we must apply. Willing is not enough, we must do.
h:
“Knowing is not enough, we must apply. Willing is not enough, we must do. ” —
Bruce Lee

q: Insanity: doing the same thing over and over again and expecting different results.
h:
“Insanity: doing the same thing over and over again and expecting different results.” —
Albert Einstein

q: Quality is not an act, it is a habit.
h:
“Quality is not an act, it is a habit.” —
Aristotle

q: There are two kinds of perfect people: those who are dead, and those who have not been born yet.
h:
“There are two kinds of perfect people: those who are dead, and those who have not been born yet.” —
Chinese Proverb

q: No need to hurry. No need to sparkle. No need to be anybody but oneself.
h:
“No need to hurry. No need to sparkle. No need to be anybody but oneself.” —
Virginia Woolf

q: Do not believe that you will reach your destination without leaving the shore.
h:
“Do not believe that you will reach your destination without leaving the shore. ” —
Chinese Proverb

q: The trouble with the rat race is that even if you win, you're still a rat.
h:
“The trouble with the rat race is that even if you win, you're still a rat.” —
Lily Tomlin

q: By changing nothing, nothing changes.
h:
“By changing nothing, nothing changes.” —
Celestine Chua

q: Some people want it to happen, some wish it would happen, others make it happen.
h:
“Some people want it to happen, some wish it would happen, others make it happen.” —
Michael Jordan

q: If I have seen further than others, it is by standing upon the shoulders of giants.
h:
“If I have seen further than others, it is by standing upon the shoulders of giants.” —
Isaac Newton

q: If you don't have time to do it right, when will you have time to do it over?
h:
“If you don't have time to do it right, when will you have time to do it over?” —

q: The secret of life isn't what happens to you, but what you do with what happens to you.
h:
“The secret of life isn't what happens to you, but what you do with what happens to you.” —

q: People think about what they don't want and attract more of the same.
h:
“People think about what they don't want and attract more of the same.” —
Unknown

q: Having lots of money while not having inner peace is like dying of thirst while bathing in the ocean.
h:
“Having lots of money while not having inner peace is like dying of thirst while bathing in the ocean.” —

q: If you're afraid - don't do it, - if you're doing it - don't be afraid!
h:
“If you're afraid - don't do it, - if you're doing it - don't be afraid! ” —
Genghis Khan

q: Follow your instincts. That is where true wisdom manifests itself.
h:
“Follow your instincts. That is where true wisdom manifests itself.” —
Oprah Winfrey

q: Always focus on the front windshield and not the rear view mirror.
h:
“Always focus on the front windshield and not the rear view mirror.” —
Colin Powell

q: The scariest monsters are the ones that lurk within our souls.
h:
“The scariest monsters are the ones that lurk within our souls.” —

q: A real decision is measured by the fact that you've taken a new action. If there's no action, you haven't truly decided.
h:
“A real decision is measured by the fact that you've taken a new action. If there's no action, you haven't truly decided.” —
Tony Robbins

q: Reality is nothing but a collective hunch.
h:
“Reality is nothing but a collective hunch.” —
Lily Tomlin

q: Decide upon your major definite purpose in life and then organize all your activities around it.
h:
“Decide upon your major definite purpose in life and then organize all your activities around it.” —
Brian Tracy

q: To find yourself, think for yourself.
h:
“To find yourself, think for yourself.” —
Socrates

q: Life is simply what our feelings do to us.
h:
“Life is simply what our feelings do to us.” —
Honore de Balzac

q: Saying nothing sometimes says the most.
h:
“Saying nothing sometimes says the most.” —
Emily Dickinson

q: Hope and fear come from feeling that we lack something; they come from a sense of poverty.
h:
“Hope and fear come from feeling that we lack something; they come from a sense of poverty.” —

q: Do what is right, not what is easy, nor what is popular.
h:
“Do what is right, not what is easy, nor what is popular.” —

q: Change is hard at first, messy in the middle and gorgeous at the end.
h:
“Change is hard at first, messy in the middle and gorgeous at the end.” —
Robin Sharma

q: Keep smiling, because life is a beautiful thing and there's so much to smile about.
h:
“Keep smiling, because life is a beautiful thing and there's so much to smile about.” —
Marilyn Monroe

q: Success on the outside means nothing unless you also have success within.
h:
“Success on the outside means nothing unless you also have success within.” —
Robin Sharma

q: The heart wants what it wants - or else it does not care.
h:
“The heart wants what it wants - or else it does not care.” —
Emily Dickinson

q: In the midst of movement and chaos, keep stillness inside of you.
h:
“In the midst of movement and chaos, keep stillness inside of you.” —
Deepak Chopra

q: I skate to where the puck is going to be, not where it has been.
h:
“I skate to where the puck is going to be, not where it has been.” —
Wayne Gretzky

q: Every day passes whether you participate or not.
h:
“Every day passes whether you participate or not.” —
Ming-Dao Deng

q: Ask no questions, and you'll be told no lies.
h:
“Ask no questions, and you'll be told no lies.” —
Charles Dickens

q: Muddy water is best cleared by leaving it alone.
h:
“Muddy water is best cleared by leaving it alone.” —
Alan Watts

q: You must welcome change as the rule but not as your ruler.
h:
“You must welcome change as the rule but not as your ruler. ” —
Denis Waitley

q: Public opinion is the worst of all opinions.
h:
“Public opinion is the worst of all opinions.” —
Nicolas Chamfort

q: Don't look back - you're not going that way.
h:
“Don't look back - you're not going that way.” —
Mary Engelbreit

q: Great deeds are usually wrought at great risks.
h:
“Great deeds are usually wrought at great risks.” —
Herodotus

q: Our truest life is when we are in dreams awake.
h:
“Our truest life is when we are in dreams awake.” —
Henry David Thoreau

q: I wasn't brave, I just didn't have time to be scared.
h:
“I wasn't brave, I just didn't have time to be scared.” —
Amelia Earhart

q: Expect the best, plan for the worst, and prepare to be surprised.
h:
“Expect the best, plan for the worst, and prepare to be surprised. ” —
Denis Waitley

q: Our attitude toward life determines life's attitude towards us.
h:
“Our attitude toward life determines life's attitude towards us.” —
Earl Nightingale

q: Never doubt that a small group of thoughtful, committed citizens can change the world; indeed, it's the only thing that ever has.
h:
“Never doubt that a small group of thoughtful, committed citizens can change the world; indeed, it's the only thing that ever has.” —
Margaret Mead

q: Successful people tend to become more successful because they are always thinking about their successes.
h:
“Successful people tend to become more successful because they are always thinking about their successes.” —
Brian Tracy

q: Every day do something that will inch you closer to a better tomorrow.
h:
“Every day do something that will inch you closer to a better tomorrow.” —
Unknown

q: Nothing is too high for a man to reach, but he must climb with care and confidence
h:
“Nothing is too high for a man to reach, but he must climb with care and confidence” —
Hans Christian Andersen

q: Most of the important things in the world have been accompanied by people who have kept on trying when there seemed to be no hope at all.
h:
“Most of the important things in the world have been accompanied by people who have kept on trying when there seemed to be no hope at all.” —
Dale Carnegie

q: True prayer has no set form.
h:
“True prayer has no set form.” —
Morihei Ueshiba

q: Peace of mind is that mental condition in which you have accepted the worst.
h:
“Peace of mind is that mental condition in which you have accepted the worst.” —
Lin Yutang

q: Don't be afraid of missing opportunities. Behind every failure is an opportunity somebody wishes they had missed.
h:
“Don't be afraid of missing opportunities. Behind every failure is an opportunity somebody wishes they had missed.” —
Lily Tomlin

q: To some degree, you control your life by controlling your time.
h:
“To some degree, you control your life by controlling your time.” —
Conrad Hilton

q: The best fighter is never angry.
h:
“The best fighter is never angry.” —
Lao Tzu

q: Everything you can imagine is real.
h:
“Everything you can imagine is real.” —
Pablo Picasso

q: We may not be responsible for the world that created our minds, but we can take responsibility for the mind with which we create our world.
h:
“We may not be responsible for the world that created our minds, but we can take responsibility for the mind with which we create our world.” —
Gabor Mate

q: Friendship is like money, easier made than kept.
h:
“Friendship is like money, easier made than kept.” —
Samuel Butler

q: Admire as much as you can. Most people do not admire enough.
h:
“Admire as much as you can. Most people do not admire enough.” —
Vincent van Gogh

q: Every man is guilty of all the good he did not do.
h:
“Every man is guilty of all the good he did not do. ” —
Voltaire

q: None of us can change our yesterdays but all of us can change our tomorrows.
h:
“None of us can change our yesterdays but all of us can change our tomorrows.” —
Colin Powell

q: You must be willing to do what others won't do, to have what others won't have.
h:
“You must be willing to do what others won't do, to have what others won't have.” —
Les Brown

q: If you haven't the strength to impose your own terms upon life, then you must accept the terms it offers you.
h:
“If you haven't the strength to impose your own terms upon life, then you must accept the terms it offers you.” —
T.S. Eliot

q: The one who praises you is a thief. The one who criticizes you is your true friend.
h:
“The one who praises you is a thief. The one who criticizes you is your true friend.” —
Seungsahn

q: Here and now...breathe and relax...in battle and in life.
h:
“Here and now...breathe and relax...in battle and in life.” —
Dan Millman

q: Change the changeable, accept the unchangeable, and remove yourself from the unacceptable.
h:
“Change the changeable, accept the unchangeable, and remove yourself from the unacceptable. ” —
Denis Waitley

q: The most difficult times for many of us are the ones we give ourselves.
h:
“The most difficult times for many of us are the ones we give ourselves.” —
Pema Chodron

q: Live in the sunshine, swim the sea, drink the wild air.
h:
“Live in the sunshine, swim the sea, drink the wild air.” —
Ralph Waldo Emerson

q: A journey of a thousand miles begins with a single step.
h:
“A journey of a thousand miles begins with a single step.” —
Lao Tzu

q: Our anxiety does not empty tomorrow of its sorrows, but only empties today of its strengths.
h:
“Our anxiety does not empty tomorrow of its sorrows, but only empties today of its strengths.” —
Charles Spurgeon

q: If you focus on success, you'll have stress. But if you pursue excellence, success will be guaranteed.
h:
“If you focus on success, you'll have stress. But if you pursue excellence, success will be guaranteed.” —
Deepak Chopra

q: The number one cause of failure is the fear of failure.
h:
“The number one cause of failure is the fear of failure.” —
Steve Harvey

q: Pleasure in the job puts perfection in the work.
h:
“Pleasure in the job puts perfection in the work.” —
Aristotle

q: The river that flows in you also flows in me.
h:
“The river that flows in you also flows in me.” —
Kabir

q: The law of harvest is to reap more than you sow. Sow an act, and you reap a habit. Sow a habit and you reap a character. Sow a character and you reap a destiny.
h:
“The law of harvest is to reap more than you sow. Sow an act, and you reap a habit. Sow a habit and you reap a character. Sow a character and you reap a destiny.” —
James Allen

q: A real decision is measured by the fact that you've taken a new action. If there's no action, you haven't truly decided.
h:
“A real decision is measured by the fact that you've taken a new action. If there's no action, you haven't truly decided.” —
Tony Robbins

q: Failure is the key to success; each mistake teaches us something.
h:
“Failure is the key to success; each mistake teaches us something.” —
Morihei Ueshiba

q: If your happiness depends on what somebody else does, I guess you do have a problem.
h:
“If your happiness depends on what somebody else does, I guess you do have a problem.” —
Richard Bach

q: You can calculate the worth of a man by the number of his enemies.
h:
“You can calculate the worth of a man by the number of his enemies.” —
Gustave Flaubert

q: The idea of ourselves is our escape from the fact of what we really are.
h:
“The idea of ourselves is our escape from the fact of what we really are.” —
Jiddu Krishnamurti

q: The first man gets the oyster, the second man gets the shell.
h:
“The first man gets the oyster, the second man gets the shell.” —
Andrew Carnegie

q: Fortunate are those who take the first steps.
h:
“Fortunate are those who take the first steps.” —
Paulo Coelho

q: Judgments prevent us from seeing the good that lies beyond appearances.
h:
“Judgments prevent us from seeing the good that lies beyond appearances. ” —
Wayne Dyer

q: Get mad, then get over it.
h:
“Get mad, then get over it.” —
Colin Powell

q: Hope itself is like a star- not to be seen in the sunshine of prosperity, and only to be discovered in the night of adversity.
h:
“Hope itself is like a star- not to be seen in the sunshine of prosperity, and only to be discovered in the night of adversity.” —
Charles Spurgeon

q: If the plan doesn't work, change the plan, but never the goal.
h:
“If the plan doesn't work, change the plan, but never the goal.” —
Unknown

q: If you want to be happy, set a goal that commands your thoughts, liberates your energy, and inspires your hopes.
h:
“If you want to be happy, set a goal that commands your thoughts, liberates your energy, and inspires your hopes.” —
Andrew Carnegie

q: To think is easy. To act is hard. But the hardest thing in the world is to act in accordance with your thinking.
h:
“To think is easy. To act is hard. But the hardest thing in the world is to act in accordance with your thinking.” —
Johann Wolfgang von Goethe

q: If I persist long enough I will win.
h:
“If I persist long enough I will win.” —
Og Mandino

q: Obstacles are those frightful things you see when you take your eyes off your goal.
h:
“Obstacles are those frightful things you see when you take your eyes off your goal.” —
Henry Ford

q: Relax. Nothing is under control.
h:
“Relax. Nothing is under control.” —
Adi Da Samraj

q: Being wrong brings the opportunity for growth.
h:
“Being wrong brings the opportunity for growth.” —
Mark Manson

q: The sun is new each day.
h:
“The sun is new each day.” —
Heraclitus

q: The present moment is filled with joy and happiness. If you are attentive, you will see it.
h:
“The present moment is filled with joy and happiness. If you are attentive, you will see it.” —
Thich Nhat Hanh

q: Fear of death is fear of surrender to Infinity. Learn to surrender, to exist at Infinity while alive, and fear of death dissolves.
h:

Adi Da Samraj

q: Little minds have little worries, big minds have no time for worries.
h:
“Little minds have little worries, big minds have no time for worries.” —
Ralph Waldo Emerson

q: Opportunity is missed by most people because it is dressed in overalls and looks like work.
h:
“Opportunity is missed by most people because it is dressed in overalls and looks like work.” —
Thomas Edison

q: Real growth comes through intense, difficult, and challenging situations.
h:
“Real growth comes through intense, difficult, and challenging situations.” —

q: A man that flies from his fear may find that he has only taken a short cut to meet it.
h:
“A man that flies from his fear may find that he has only taken a short cut to meet it.” —
J.R.R. Tolkien

q: As soon as you truly commit to making something happen, the 'how' will reveal itself.
h:
“As soon as you truly commit to making something happen, the 'how' will reveal itself.” —

q: It is the power of the mind to be unconquerable.
h:

q: Believe in one thing too much and you have no room for new ideas.
h:
“Believe in one thing too much and you have no room for new ideas. ” —

q: Happiness can be found, even in the darkest of times, if one only remembers to turn on the light.
h:

q: Everyone can rise above their circumstances and achieve success if they are dedicated to and passionate about what they do.
h:

q: The person who never made a mistake never tried anything new.
h:
“The person who never made a mistake never tried anything new.” —

q: Those who look for the bad in people will surely find it.
h:

q: Quality is not an act, it is a habit.

q: Be willing to be a beginner every single morning.

q: Faith means believing the unbelievable.
h:

q: Never allow someone to be your priority while allowing yourself to be their option.
h:

Mark Twain

q: The purpose of life is the expansion of happiness.
h:

q: The world doesn't owe you anything. It was here first.
h:

Mark Twain

q: It is not the knowing that is difficult, but the doing.
h:

q: Health is the greatest of all possessions.
h:

q: The greatest treasures are those invisible to the eye but found by the heart.
h:

q: Do Something. If it works, do more of it. If it doesn't, do something else.
h:

q: The wise speak only of what they know.
h:

J.R.R. Tolkien

h:

q: Any game becomes important when you know and love the players.

q: I can never decide whether my dreams are the result of my thoughts or my thoughts the result of my dreams.

q: Love is the absence of judgment.
h:

q: Wherever you are, it's the place you need to be.
h:

q: Like it or not, this moment is all we really have to work with.
h:

q: Death smiles at us all. All we can do is smile back.
h:

q: The goal is not to show how great you are to others, but how vulnerable you are to yourself.

h:

q: Excellence is not an exception, it is a prevailing attitude.

h:

q: A creative man is motivated by the desire to achieve, not by the desire to beat others.
h:

h:

q: Confidence is the greatest friend.
h:

q: The enemy is a very good teacher.
h:

q: Your happiness is what truly matters most. Do what you have to do in order to be happy.
h:

q: Superstars think like superstars long before the fans or the press anoint them.
h:

h:

h:

h:

q: Common sense is not so common.

q: We all give up great expectations along the way.

q: If you want peace, accept. If you want suffering, expect.

q: Use your smile to change the world but don't let the world change your smile.
h:

q: People become attached to their burdens sometimes more than the burdens are attached to them.

q: The best way to understanding is a few good examples.
h:

q: To injure an opponent is to injure yourself. To control aggression without inflicting injury is the Art of Peace.
h:

q: People spend too much time doing and not enough time thinking about what they should be doing.

q: When things go wrong, don't go with them.
h:

q: Everyone thinks of changing the world, but no one thinks of changing himself.
h:

q: Every second you have on this planet is very precious and it's your responsibility that you're happy.
h:

q: Death is not an ending. It is a transformation.
h:

q: Success is nothing more than a few simple disciplines practiced every day.
h:

h:

q: You can't let your failures define you. You have to let your failures teach you.
h:

q: Everyone has oceans to fly, if they have the heart to do it. Is it reckless? Maybe. But what do dreams know of boundaries.

q: Human beings believe just as they breathe - in order to survive.
h:

q: The most efficient way of rendering the poor harmless is to teach them to want to imitate the rich.

q: What do we live for if not to make life less difficult for each other?

h:

q: When you are totally at peace with yourself, nothing can shake you.
h:

q: No man can get rich himself unless he enriches others.
h:

h:

q: We take care of the future best by taking care of the present now.

q: The whole is greater than the sum of its parts.
h:

q: Successful people appreciate where they have come from, but they don't let their past set the tone for their future.
h:

q: Your life does not get better by chance, it gets better by change.
h:

q: All power is from within and therefore under our control.
h:

q: If you're not failing every now and again, it's a sign you're not doing anything very innovative.
h:

q: Anger is an acid that can do more harm to the vessel in which it is stored than to anything on which it is poured.
h:

q: The whole of life, from the moment you are born to the moment you die, is a process of learning.

q: Don't hate the player. Change the game.
h:

Steve Harvey

q: The greatest discovery of all time is that a person can change their future by merely changing their attitude.

q: Nothing can bring you peace but yourself.
h:
“Nothing can bring you peace but yourself.” —
Dale Carnegie

q: Live, travel, adventure, bless, and don't be sorry.
h:

q: True friendship ought never to conceal what it thinks.
h:

q: The goal is not to show how great you are to others, but how vulnerable you are to yourself.
h:

h:

q: It doesn't matter how slow you go, as long as you don't stop.

h:

q: Live calmly. The time will come when the flowers bloom by themselves.
h:

q: If your happiness depends on what somebody else does, I guess you do have a problem.
h:

q: Everything that is made beautiful and fair and lovely is made for the eye of one who sees.

h:

q: Life belongs to the living, and he who lives must be prepared for changes.

q: I know of only one duty, and that is to love.
h:

q: When I let go of what I am, I become what I might be.
h:

q: The mirror is a worthless invention. The only way to truly see yourself is in the reflection of someone elses. eyes.
h:

q: Don't be afraid to go slowly. Be afraid of stopping.
h:

q: Quiet people have the loudest minds.
h:

q: What a book a devil's chaplain might write on the clumsy, wasteful, blundering, low, and horribly cruel work of nature!
h:

q: Respect is earned by effort not age, all things age without effort.
h:

h:
“If you've never eaten while crying you don t know what life tastes like.” —

q: Keep your face to the sunshine and you cannot see the shadows.
h:

q: Live your life as an exclamation rather than an explanation.

q: One of the advantages of being disorganized is that one is always having surprising discoveries.
h:

q: The giving of love is an education in itself.
h:
“The giving of love is an education in itself.” —

q: The road to success is always under construction.
h:

q: Progress comes to those who train and train; reliance on secret techniques will get you nowhere.
h:

q: Time and health are two precious assets that we don't recognize and appreciate until they have been depleted.

q: He who leaves the game wins it.
h:

q: To raise your consciousness, surround yourself with people of higher consciousness.

q: Repetition does not transform a lie into a truth.

q: All cruelty springs from weakness.

q: Your vision will become clear only when you can look into your own heart.

q: The world makes way for the man who knows where he is going.
h:

q: Time heals what reason cannot.
h:

Seneca

q: The educated differ from the uneducated as much as the living differ from the dead.
h:

Aristotle

q: Let each man exercise the art he knows.
h:
“Let each man exercise the art he knows.” —
Aristophanes

q: Normality is a paved road: It's comfortable to walk, but no flowers grow on it.
h:

q: There is no right or wrong, only a series of possibilities that shift with each thought, feeling, and action that you experience.
h:

q: Life is about accepting the challenges along the way, choosing to keep moving forward, and savoring the journey.

q: Failure is the highway to success.
h:

q: Peace of mind is that mental condition in which you have accepted the worst.

q: You can easily judge the character of a man by how he treats those who can do nothing for him.
h:

q: Take into account that great love and great achievements involve great risk.
h:

q: Success is not final, failure is not fatal: it is the courage to continue that counts.
h:

q: A loving heart is the truest wisdom.
h:
“A loving heart is the truest wisdom.” —

q: Just living is not enough... one must have sunshine, freedom, and a little flower.
h:

q: The best fighter is never angry.
h:
“The best fighter is never angry.” —
Lao Tzu

q: Those who attain the middle Dominate the whole.
h:
“Those who attain the middle Dominate the whole.” —
Ming-Dao Deng

q: Natural talent only determines the limits of your athletic potential. It's dedication and a willingness to discipline your life that makes you great.
h:

q: The key to immortality is first living a life worth remembering.
h:
